snippet: Rob Speyer’s company is rushing to qualify for a tax break on a big residential complex in Queens without a key part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s agenda: affordable units.
abstract: Close relationship between New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and real estate developer Rob Speyer is being tried by their differences over affordable housing; Tishman Speyer Properties is set to break ground on $875 million complex in Long Island City, Queens, that will not be subject to new rules requiring 20 percent of units to be set aside for poor and moderate-income tenants; affordable housing has been top priority for de Blasio.
lead_paragraph: Rob Speyer’s company is rushing to qualify for a tax break on a big residential complex in Queens without a key part of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s agenda: affordable units.

headline.main: De Blasio and Developer Are Close, but Not on Lower-Cost Housing
headline.print_headline: De Blasio and Builder Are Close, but Not on Affordable Housing
